All Strategies

The full list of strategies are included below:

  • E-Assessment (5)
  • Flexible & Adaptive Learning (4)
  • Interaction Between Students (8)
  • Interaction with the Professions (6)
  • Interactive Resources (5)
  • Learning Communities (8)
  • Teacher Presence (4)

E-Assessment

  • Collaborative Group Projects - Students interact in order to achieve a shared goal
  • Computer Based Exams - Replacing paper based exams
  • Creating Rich Media Artefacts - Assessment using photos, audio, video and multimedia presentations
  • Online Marking & Effective Feedback - Providing students with personalised feedback
  • Simulations & Exploratory Learning - Providing students with environments and situations that mimic the real world

Flexible & Adaptive Learning

  • Adapting Learning Resources - Using data analytics to adjust learning resource provision
  • Choice Within Assessments - Allowing students to draw on their own discipline knowledge experiences in their assessments
  • Computer Based Exams - Replacing paper based exams
  • Simulations & Exploratory Learning - Providing students with environments and situations that mimic the real world

Interaction Between Students

  • Asynchronous Discussions - Creating opportunities for flexible dialogue
  • Choice Within Assessments - Allowing students to draw on their own discipline knowledge experiences in their assessments
  • Collaborative Group Projects - Students interact in order to achieve a shared goal
  • Creating a Shared Resource - Student co-creating resources for learning
  • Reflective Journals - Utilising reflective practices to build students personal and professional identity
  • Role Play - Students assume a role to resolve a problem or create an artefact
  • Simulations & Exploratory Learning - Providing students with environments and situations that mimic the real world
  • Social Media Streams - Using social media to publish and accessing information in realtime

Interaction with the Professions

  • Choice Within Assessments - Allowing students to draw on their own discipline knowledge experiences in their assessments
  • Guest Lectures - Inviting practitioners and experts to engage directly with students
  • Reflective Journals - Utilising reflective practices to build students personal and professional identity
  • Role Play - Students assume a role to resolve a problem or create an artefact
  • Simulations & Exploratory Learning - Providing students with environments and situations that mimic the real world
  • Social Media Streams - Using social media to publish and accessing information in realtime

Interactive Resources

  • Adapting Learning Resources - Using data analytics to adjust learning resource provision
  • Creating Rich Media Artefacts - Assessment using photos, audio, video and multimedia presentations
  • Online Marking & Effective Feedback - Providing students with personalised feedback
  • Simulations & Exploratory Learning - Providing students with environments and situations that mimic the real world
  • Video Lectures - Video for online students provides a richer engagement with the subject concepts

Learning Communities

  • Asynchronous Discussions - Creating opportunities for flexible dialogue
  • Collaborative Group Projects - Students interact in order to achieve a shared goal
  • Creating a Shared Resource - Student co-creating resources for learning
  • Dividing Large Cohorts - Dividing a large cohort of students into smaller sub-cohorts
  • Orientation to the Environment - Making students comfortable in navigating the online environment
  • Role Play - Students assume a role to resolve a problem or create an artefact
  • Social Media Streams - Using social media to publish and accessing information in realtime
  • Welcome Videos - Establishing the context for teaching, learning and assessment in your subject

Teacher Presence

  • Asynchronous Discussions - Creating opportunities for flexible dialogue
  • Orientation to the Environment - Making students comfortable in navigating the online environment
  • Video Lectures - Video for online students provides a richer engagement with the subject concepts
  • Welcome Videos - Establishing the context for teaching, learning and assessment in your subject
